title: Abstracted Code Representation for Review

problem.en: Reviewing large volumes of AI-generated code line-by-line is tedious, error-prone, and inefficient. Human reviewers are often more interested in verifying high-level intent and logical correctness than minute syntactic details.
problem.ko: 대량의 AI 생성 코드를 한 줄씩 검토하는 것은 지루하고, 오류가 발생하기 쉬우며, 비효율적입니다. 인간 검토자는 종종 미세한 구문 세부사항보다 높은 수준의 의도와 논리적 정확성을 검증하는 데 더 관심이 있습니다.

solution.en: Provide higher-level abstracted representation of code changes for review: pseudocode, intent summaries, logical diffs, or visualizations. This must come with guarantees that it accurately maps to actual low-level code modifications.
solution.ko: 리뷰를 위한 코드 변경의 더 높은 수준의 추상화된 표현 제공: 의사코드, 의도 요약, 논리적 diff, 또는 시각화. 이는 실제 저수준 코드 수정에 정확하게 매핑된다는 보장이 함께 제공되어야 합니다.

mermaid_diagram:
flowchart TD
    A[AI Generates Code] --> B[Abstraction Layer]
    B --> C[Pseudocode View]
    B --> D[Intent Summary]
    B --> E[Logical Diff]
    B --> F[Flow Visualization]
    C --> G[Human Review]
    D --> G
    E --> G
    F --> G
    G --> H{Conceptually Correct?}
    H -->|Yes| I[Approve with Confidence]
    H -->|No| J[Request Changes]
    I --> K[Guaranteed Mapping to Real Code]
code_example:
# Instead of reviewing 50 lines of Python implementing sorting:

# TRADITIONAL REVIEW (tedious):
# + def quicksort(arr):
# +     if len(arr) <= 1:
# +         return arr
# +     pivot = arr[len(arr) // 2]
# +     left = [x for x in arr if x < pivot]
# +     ... (50 more lines)

# ABSTRACTED REVIEW (fast):
change_summary = {
    'intent': 'Changed sorting logic for user_list',
    'from': 'bubble sort',
    'to': 'quicksort',
    'reason': 'Improve performance for large lists',
    'test_coverage': 'maintained',
    'complexity_change': 'O(n^2) → O(n log n)',
    'mapping_guarantee': 'verified'
}

# Reviewer can approve conceptual change
# with confidence it maps to correct implementation
